articles.name: CS 391
articles.imageDescription: A student taking the CS 391 course (1952 colorized)
articles.markdown:
CS 391 Web Application Development Course
## Course Content 
### Topics
 This course, aims to make students learn and implement web application development using timely technologies and frameworks with a focus on client side app development technologies. 
### Course Earnings 
 Defining fundamental terms and concepts about web application development.
Identifying suitable technic and tools for web application development.
Developing a dynamic and reactive web application. 
### AKTS 
 4.00 
### Grading Criteria 
 Letter Grade 
### Prerequisites 
 (CS 102 or CS 105) and SEC 201 and SEC 202 
### Course Language 
 English

articles.name: CS 240
articles.markdown:
CS 240 Computer Architecture Course
## Course Content 
### Topics
 Topics include design of a basic CPU on FPGA, instruction pipeline, RISC versus CISC, ALU design, Von Neumann vs Harvard architecture, memory hierarchy, OS support, interrupts, microcontrollers (MCU) versus microprocessors (uP), system buses, peripherals such as hard disk.
### Course Earnings 
To understand components of a computer system and how they work.
To understand how a simple cpu works and assembly programming.
Designing a basic cpu on Fpga through verilog language.
### AKTS 
 6.00 
### Grading Criteria 
 Letter Grade 
### Prerequisites 
 EE 203  
### Course Language 
 English

articles.name: CS 333
articles.markdown:
CS 333 Algorithm Analysis Course
## Course Content 
### Topics
 Topics include Greedy/Dynamic Programming/Divide and Conquer algorithm design paradigms, Graph algorithms (minimum path, spanning tree, max flow), and intractability (NP & NPcomplete problem classes).
### Course Earnings 
 Designing algorithms with Greedy, Dynamic Programming, Divide and Conquer techniques.
 Displaying correctness of an algorithm.
 Deciding efficiency of an algorithm.
 Showing the hardness of calculational problems. 
### AKTS 
 6.00 
### Grading Criteria 
 Letter Grade 
### Prerequisites 
 CS 201  
### Course Language 
 English

articles.name: CS 350
articles.markdown:
CS 350 Operating Systems Course 
## Course Content 
### Topics
 This course covers the fundamental concepts of operating systems (OS), as well as the major components of OS', their mechanisms and interactions. Subjects include process management, scheduling, synchronization, locks, memory management, virtualization, input-output, storage and file systems. Students gain practical knowledge by examining the kernel of the open-source Linux OS and by implementing device drivers. Other advanced topics include system security, multicore and distributed computing, OS' for mobile devices, and energy efficiency.
### Course Earnings 
 Identifying main objectives of an operating system.
 Being able to name modules in the core of an operating system.
 Writing and running scripts about system management on an operating system.
Being able to discuss about management of hardware resources such as processor, memory, input-output. 
Identifying important data structures inside operating system source code. 
### AKTS 
 6.00 
### Grading Criteria 
 Letter Grade 
### Prerequisites 
 CS 201  
### Course Language 
 English
